title: Power Button Functionality
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the LG remote with the LG TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I first press the power button to check if it turns the LG TV ON

AND I press the power button again to check if it turns the LG TV OFF
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice that the LG TV turns ON when I first press the power button

THEN I should notice that the LG TV turns OFF when I press the power button again

title: Menu Navigation Functionality
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have logged into the MLB.TV app at the LG's TV menu options section
custom_steps:
WHEN I press the Up button in LG's TV menu options
AND I press the Down button in LG's TV menu options
AND I press the Left button in LG's TV menu options
AND I press the Right button in LG's TV menu options
AND I press the OK button in LG's TV menu options
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice the Up button navigates Up in LG's TV menu options
THEN I should notice the Down button navigates Downward in LG's TV menu options
THEN I should notice the Left button navigates to the left in LG's TV menu options
THEN I should notice the Right button navigates to the right in LG's TV menu options
THEN I should notice the OK button operates as a Select button in LG's TV menu options

title: Smart TV Features
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have a LG TV remote with Smart TV Functions
custom_steps:
WHEN I launch the MLB.TV app
AND I select any streaming service 
AND I select the voice control feature from the LG TV remote
custom_expected:
THEN the MLB.TV app should launch without issue
THEN the streaming service should start to play without issue
THEN the voice control should allow the use of my voice to be used

title: Volume Controls
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the LG remote with the LG TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I press the Volume Up button
AND I press the Volume Down button
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice the volume increasing 
THEN I should notice the volume decreasing

title: Channel Controls
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the LG remote with the LG TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I press the channel Up button
AND I press the channel Down button
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice the channel moving up to the Next channel 

THEN I should notice the channel moving down to the Previous channel

title: Remote App Function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a LG Smart TV
GIVEN I have a smartphone with the SmartShare app installed
custom_steps:
WHEN I select enable "Wi-Fi Direct" on the smartphone
AND I select Smart Home ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14188509) > Settings > ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14188510)
AND I select "Wi-Fi Direct" to be turned "On"
AND I select "Yes" on the smartphone
AND I tap "Accept" on the smartphone 
AND I run the "SmartShare" app on the smartphone
AND I tap "From" selecting "My phone"
AND I tap "To" to select the Smart TV
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice that the Wi-FI connection was set to "On" successfully
THEN I should be able to select "Yes" to send a connection request from your Smart TV to the smartphone
THEN "Accept" should be able to complete the connection
THEN the "SmartShare" app should launch successfully
THEN I should be able to select "My Phone"
THEN I should be able to tap "To" to select the Smart TV and complete the connection
THEN I should be able to send content from the My Phone folder to the TV in order to view it on the Smart TV

title: Button Press Test
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have the Xbox controller connected to the console
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Xbox (4) button/Nexus button

WHEN I Press and Hold the Xbox (4) button

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14344227)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14344743)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14344744)
custom_expected:
THEN the Xbox console/PC should open the guide on the Xbox console

THEN I should notice on a PC during game play that the Game Bar opens

THEN I should notice when I Press and Hold the Xbox (4) button that it opens the 

THEN I should notice when I Press and Hold the Xbox (4) button for about 6 seconds that the controller should turn off

title: All Buttons Press Test
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am logged into the MLB.TV app
custom_steps:
WHEN I connect the gamepad controller to the computer

AND I press the LEFT STICK (1) button 

AND I press the LEFT BUMPER (2) button

AND I press the VIEW (3) button

AND I release the VIEW (3) button

AND I press the MENU (6) button 

AND I press the RIGHT BUMPER (7) button

AND I press the DIRECTIONAL PAD (D-pad) (8) button

AND I press the RIGHT STICK (10) button

AND I press the "A" button

AND I press the "B" button

AND I press the "X" button

AND I press the "Y" button

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14345375)

![](index.php?/attachments/get/14345376)
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14345377)
custom_expected:
THEN the LEFT STICK (1) button should function as a clickable button and move directionally

THEN the LEFT BUMPER (2) button button should allow the user to jump between sections of the of the user interface

THEN the LEFT BUMPER (2) button should be released without issue

THEN the VIEW (3) button should function as intended in the MLB.TV app

THEN the MENU (6) button should allow the user to access the MLB.TV app's menu options: "Settings", "Help" and "Go To Channel"

THEN the RIGHT BUMPER (7) button should allow the user to jump between sections of the of the user interface

THEN DIRECTIONAL PAD (D-pad) (8) button should allow the user to move the focus up, down, right, and left in the MLB .TV app

THEN the RIGHT STICK (10) button should function as a clickable button and move directionally

THEN the "A" button should interact with the app and the console interface

THEN the "B" button should interact with the app and the console interface.

THEN the "X" button should interact with the app and the console interface

THEN the "Y" button should interact with the app and the console interface

title: A, B, X, Y Button Press Test
custom_preconds: GIVEN I am logged into the MLB.TV app
custom_steps:
WHEN I press the "A" button to Select to play a game
WHEN I press the "B" button to Cancel playing the game
WHEN I press the "X" button to interact with the MLB.TV app
WHEN I press the "Y" button to interact with the MLB.TV app
![](index.php?/attachments/get/14345379)
custom_expected:
THEN I should be able to SELECT a game successfully
THEN I should be able to CANCEL playing a game successfully
THEN I should be able to interact throughout the MLB.TV app
THEN I should be able to interact throughout the MLB.TV app

custom_preconds: GIVEN I have connected the analog stick to the console
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Left Thumbstick (1) button

THEN I should notice that the Left Thumbstick (1) interacts with the MLB.TV app and Xbox console

THEN I should notice that the Right Thumbstick (11) interacts with the MLB.TV app and Xbox console

title: Analog Stick Test
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have connected the analog stick to the console

Refer manual for more info- https://manuals.plus/playstation/ps5-dual-sense-wireless-controller-manual
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Left Thumbstick (L1) button 
AND I Press the Left Thumbstick (L2) button

AND I Press the Right Thumbstick (R1) button
AND I Press the Right Thumbstick (R2) button
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice the Left Thumbstick (L1) button to move to the Left
THEN I should notice the Left Thumbstick (L2) button to move to the Left

THEN I should notice the Right Thumbstick (R1) button to move to the Right
THEN I should notice the Right Thumbstick (R2) button to move to the Right

title: Directional Buttons Press Test
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have paired the PS 5 Controller to the PS 5 Console

Refer manual for more info- https://manuals.plus/playstation/ps5-dual-sense-wireless-controller-manual
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Directional Button (A) Up
AND I Press the Directional Button (A) Down
AND I Press the Directional Button (A) Left
AND I Press the Directional Button (A) Right
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice that the Directional Button (A) move Up
THEN I should notice that the Directional Button (A) move Down
THEN I should notice that the Directional Button (A) move Left
THEN I should notice that the Directional Button (A) move Right

title: All Button Press Test
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the PS 5 Controller to the PS 5 Console
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the "PS" (G) button once
AND I Press and Hold the "PS" (G) button
AND I Press the "Create" (B) button
AND I Press the "Touch pad/touch pad" (C) button
AND I Press the "Options" (D) button
AND I Press the "Actions/Cross" button
AND I Press the "Actions/Circle" button
AND I Press the "Actions/Triangle" button
AND I Press the "Actions/Square" button
AND I Press the "Left stick/L3" button
AND I Press the "Right stick/R3" button
AND I Press the "Mute" button
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice pressing the "PS" (G) button once accesses the control center
THEN I should notice pressing and holding the "PS" (G) button should go to the home screen
THEN I should notice that the "Create" button displays the Create menu
THEN I should notice that the "Touch pad/touch pad" button is recognized for gameplay functions
THEN I should notice that the "Options" button displays the Option menu
THEN I should notice the "Actions/Cross" button selects the highlighted item
THEN I should notice the "Actions/Circle" button cancels a command
THEN I should notice the "Actions/Triangle" button rearranges the items in a list, or views related information
THEN I should notice the "Actions/Square" button can be used as a shortcut for context-sensitive commands
THEN I should notice the "Left stick/L3" button can be used for movement and gameplay functions
THEN I should notice the "Right stick/R3" button can be used for movement and gameplay functions
THEN I should notice that the "Mute" button mutes the controller mic and speaker

title: Power Button Test
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have the PS5 controller connected to the PS5 

Refer manual for more info- https://manuals.plus/playstation/ps5-dual-sense-wireless-controller-manual
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the PlayStation button once

AND I Press and Hold the PlayStation button
custom_expected:
THEN I should expect the PlayStation 5 console to recognize the controller and sync with it

THEN I should expect the PlayStation 5 to go to the home screen after pressing and holding down the PlayStation  button

title: Power Button
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the Samsung TV remote with the Samsung TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I press the Red Power![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189421) button 
AND I press the Red Power![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189421) button again
custom_expected:
THEN the Samsung TV should turn ON successfully

THEN the Samsung TV should turn OFF successfully

NOTE: (If it doesn't work, try replacing the batteries)

title: Button Menu Navigation
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the Remote Control to the Samsung TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Directional "Up" button
AND I Press the Directional "Down" button
AND I Press the Directional "Left" button
AND I Press the Directional "Right" button
custom_expected:
THEN I should be able to navigate the menu that point in the Up direction
THEN I should be able to navigate the menu that point in the Down direction
THEN I should be able to navigate the menu that point in the Left direction
THEN I should be able to navigate the menu that point in the Right direction

title: All Buttons
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have paired the Samsung TV remote with the Samsung TV
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the SmartHub![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189420) button 

AND I Press the Return ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189422) button

AND I Press the Play/Pause ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189423) button

AND I Press the  +  button

AND I Press the  -  button

AND I Press the "Select" (2) ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189426) button 

AND I Press the Up Arrow button

AND I Press the Down Arrow button

AND I Press the (1) button Inside the Circle ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189426)

AND I Press and Hold the Volume button

AND I Press the (Color - Number (123)) ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189424) button

AND I Press the Mic ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189425)button

AND I Press the "Accessibility Shortcuts" ![](index.php?/attachments/get/14189427) button
custom_expected:
THEN I should be returned to the Home screen
THEN I should return to the Previous screen or menu
THEN I should notice that the Play/Pause button plays or pauses the video that's playing
THEN I should notice the Volume increasing
THEN I should notice the Volume decreasing
THEN I should notice the Channel moves Up by one
THEN I should notice the Channel moves Down by one
THEN I should notice the button Inside the Circle acts as the Select button
THEN I should notice that the "Accessibility Shortcuts" menu is displayed
THEN I should buttons window and Virtual Numeric keypad are displayed alternatively
THEN I should notice the Mic button activates the Voice Assistant
THEN I should notice the Accessibility Shortcuts menu is displayed

title: Remote App Function
custom_preconds:
GIVEN I have a Samsung Account
GIVEN I have Wi-Fi enabled on the smartphone and on the SAME Wi-Fi network as your Samsung TV
GIVEN I have the SmartThings app installed on the smartphone
custom_steps:
WHEN I Press the Red Power button 
AND I Open the SmartThings App on the smartphone
AND I tap the "Device" tab
AND I tap the "Home" icon
AND I tap to select a location where the Samsung TV is located
AND I tap the "Add" + sign
AND I tap "TV" under the "By device type" tab
AND I tap "Samsung"
AND I tap "TV" again
AND I tap "Start"
AND I tap to select a Location and Room
AND I tap "Next"
AND I tap to select the Samsung TV
AND I tap "OK" 
AND I tap "Done"
custom_expected:
THEN I should notice that the Samsung TV has been added successfully
THEN I should notice that I can now use the Smartphone to control the Samsung TV

title: Sync Remote to TV
custom_preconds: GIVEN I have the Samsung TV turned ON
custom_steps:
WHEN I Point the Smart Remote at the Remote Control Sensor on the Samsung TV (located on the lower right-hand side of the TV)

AND I Press and Hold the "Return" and "Play/Pause" buttons simultaneously for 3 seconds
custom_expected: THEN I should be able to sync the Samsung TV with the Smart Remote successfully
